intro: Gagea humicola, commonly known as the woodland gagea, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the family Liliaceae and is characterized by its bulbous underground stem and grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers that bloom in early spring. It thrives in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and forest understories. Its botanical features make it an important component of the native flora in its habitat.
